abstract.text: Oxidative stress plays an important role in cancer development and treatment.
Recent data implicate the tumor suppressor BRCA1 in regulating oxidative stress, but the molecular mechanism and the impact in BRCA1-associated tumorigenesis remain unclear.
Here, we show that BRCA1 regulates Nrf2-dependent antioxidant signaling by physically interacting with Nrf2 and promoting its stability and activation.
BRCA1-deficient mouse primary mammary epithelial cells show low expression of Nrf2-regulated antioxidant enzymes and accumulate reactive oxygen species (ROS) that impair survival in vivo.
Increased Nrf2 activation rescues survival and ROS levels in BRCA1-null cells.
Interestingly, 53BP1 inactivation, which has been shown to alleviate several defects associated with BRCA1 loss, rescues survival of BRCA1-null cells without restoring ROS levels.
We demonstrate that estrogen treatment partially restores Nrf2 levels in the absence of BRCA1.
Our data suggest that Nrf2-regulated antioxidant response plays a crucial role in controlling survival downstream of BRCA1 loss.
The ability of estrogen to induce Nrf2 posits an involvement of an estrogen-Nrf2 connection in BRCA1 tumor suppression.
Lastly, BRCA1-mutated tumors retain a defective antioxidant response that increases the sensitivity to oxidative stress.
In conclusion, the role of BRCA1 in regulating Nrf2 activity suggests important implications for both the etiology and treatment of BRCA1-related cancers.

body_text.text: (Fig. 1) caused by impaired Nrf2-mediated antioxidant signaling ( Fig. 2) and BRCA1 regulates Nrf2 transcription and protein stability by interacting with Nrf2 (Figs. 2 and 3).
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: Our data also postulate the existence of a positive regulatory feedback loop between BRCA1 and Nrf2 that is sustained by other recent studies (Kang et al., 2011;Wang et al., 2013).
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: We then translated our in vitro findings to the in vivo fat pad transplantation assay.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: In the absence of additional events, we demonstrated that BRCA1-related oxidative stress is, at least partially, responsible for the impaired repopulation defects of Brca1-null pMECs in the mammary gland (Figs. 4  and 5).
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: As a proof, Nrf2 constitutive activation by Keap1 silencing is able to rescue ROS levels, Nqo1 down-regulation, and in vivo survival caused by Brca1 deficiency (Fig. 5).
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: The role of BRCA1 as sensor and regulator of ROS has important implications in BRCA1-associated tumor formation.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: Among the previously characterized cellular defects induced by BRCA1 deficiency such as lack of DNA repair and cell cycle abnormalities, high oxidative stress may represent another barrier that prevents transformation of BRCA1deficient cells.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: From this study, it appears that the control of DNA damage signaling through 53BP1 and the regulation of ROS homeostasis through Nrf2 are two parallel and independent pathways downstream of BRCA1.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: However, both pathways are required to alleviate the survival defect in BRCA1-null cells.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: The tissue specificity of the tumors that develop in BRCA1 mutation carriers invokes a critical role for estrogen signaling.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: Our findings suggest that estrogen plays a role in regulating Nrf2 activation and in particular may counteract down-regulation of Nrf2-dependent signaling induced by BRCA1 loss to promote cell survival (Fig. 6).
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: Increased survival of BRCA1-deficient cells permits proliferation and increases genomic instability and acquisition of p53, 53BP1, and/or PTEN mutations that promote malignant transformation.
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: Current efforts are devoted to the discovery of novel and more efficacious therapies to treat BRCA1-mutated breast cancers (Drost and Jonkers, 2009;Foulkes et al., 2010).
body_text.section: NQO1 expression correlates with tumor-associated BRCA1 loss or mutation

body_text.text: In this context, our study suggests that deregulated Nrf2-dependent antioxidant signaling sensitizes human BRCA1-mutated tumors to chemotherapy-induced oxidative stress and may provide new avenues for therapeutic intervention.
